newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: ASEAN sets July for admitting Burma, other members.
newsitem.headline: ASEAN sets July for admitting Burma, other members.

text.p: The Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN) on Saturday decided to admit its last three members -- Burma, Cambodia and Laos -- in July, Indonesian Foreign Minister Ali Alatas said.

"It will be in July," Alatas told reporters after the seven- member ASEAN met to decide when exactly to admit the three. Last year, ASEAN -- comprising Malaysia, Indonesia, Brunei, the Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam -- agreed to admit Burma, Cambodia and Laos as a group some time this year

The induction of the group's last three members will take place at ASEAN's annual ministerial meeting in Kuala Lumpur on July 24-25. A new logo, featuring 10 rice stalks representing all 10 of Southeast Asian nations, would be unveiled then.
ASEAN has been under considerable pressure to defer Burma's admission because of its poor human rights record.
But the group has insisted that its policy of "constructive engagement" with Rangoon's military rulers is the only way to keep Burma on the path toward democratic and free-market reforms.
